item.title: Apple Unveils Three New iPhones, But The Watch Sends Shares Up
item.description: September 12, 2017 - Apple is freeing the watch from the iPhone, giving it a direct cellphone connection. The special-release iPhone X ditches the home button, gets facial recognition and wireless charging.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: September 12, 2017 - Apple is freeing the watch from the iPhone, giving it a direct cellphone connection. The special-release iPhone X ditches the home button, gets facial recognition and wireless charging. http://www.npr.org/sections/thetwo-way/2017/09/12/550428192/apple-unveils-three-new-iphones-but-the-watch-sends-shares-up

item.title: Apple Unveils Highly Anticipated iPhone 10 To Mark Device's Anniversary
item.description: September 12, 2017 - Apple staged a big event Tuesday to unveil new products. The iPhone 10 debuts on the 10th anniversary of the iPhone and costs $1,000.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: September 12, 2017 - Apple staged a big event Tuesday to unveil new products. The iPhone 10 debuts on the 10th anniversary of the iPhone and costs $1,000. http://www.npr.org/2017/09/12/550492818/apple-unveils-highly-anticipated-iphone-10-to-mark-devices-anniversary

item.title: Tesla Remotely Expanded Car Batteries Near Irma's Path, And Questions Linger
item.description: September 12, 2017 - It's not the first time Tesla has made over-the-air changes to its cars. The boost gave customers' cars an extra 30 to 40 miles — but the batteries will lose their extra juice this weekend.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: September 12, 2017 - It's not the first time Tesla has made over-the-air changes to its cars. The boost gave customers' cars an extra 30 to 40 miles — but the batteries will lose their extra juice this weekend. http://www.npr.org/sections/thetwo-way/2017/09/12/550445863/tesla-remotely-expanded-car-batteries-near-irmas-path-and-questions-linger

item.title: News Brief: Irma Weakens, Clinton Memoir And New iPhone
item.description: September 12, 2017 - While Irma has weakened, it is still bringing heavy rain to the Southeast. And, there are some big releases on Tuesday: Hillary Clinton's new memoir and Apple's latest iPhone iteration.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: September 12, 2017 - While Irma has weakened, it is still bringing heavy rain to the Southeast. And, there are some big releases on Tuesday: Hillary Clinton's new memoir and Apple's latest iPhone iteration. http://www.npr.org/2017/09/12/550352883/morning-news-brief

item.title: 'World Without Mind': How Tech Companies Pose An Existential Threat
item.description: September 11, 2017 - From Facebook's algorithms to our reliance on phones instead of our memories, tech giants are taking us to a future that's either utopian or dystopian, author Franklin Foer says.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: September 11, 2017 - From Facebook's algorithms to our reliance on phones instead of our memories, tech giants are taking us to a future that's either utopian or dystopian, author Franklin Foer says. http://www.npr.org/sections/alltechconsidered/2017/09/11/550177421/world-without-mind-how-tech-companies-pose-an-existential-threat

item.title: On iPhone's 10th Anniversary, Apple Has A Go At A Big Redesign
item.description: September 11, 2017 - Among the devices Apple is expected to launch Tuesday is an iPhone potentially priced at around $1,000. It's expected to include facial recognition and do away with the home button.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: September 11, 2017 - Among the devices Apple is expected to launch Tuesday is an iPhone potentially priced at around $1,000. It's expected to include facial recognition and do away with the home button. http://www.npr.org/sections/alltechconsidered/2017/09/11/541126201/on-iphones-10th-birthday-apple-has-a-go-at-a-big-redesign

item.title: Telecom Companies Turn To Drones For Help After Hurricanes
item.description: September 10, 2017 - Cellphone service outages can leave people unable to ask for help or get in touch with family and friends to say they are alive, but drones can help assess damage and get things running again.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: September 10, 2017 - Cellphone service outages can leave people unable to ask for help or get in touch with family and friends to say they are alive, but drones can help assess damage and get things running again. http://www.npr.org/2017/09/10/549922317/telecom-companies-turn-to-drones-for-help-after-hurricanes

item.title: Equifax Breach Exposes Personal Data Of 143 Million People
item.description: September 8, 2017 - Equifax says it suffered a massive data breach involving as many as 143 million people in the U.S. Social Security numbers, birth dates, addresses and drivers licenses were apparently exposed, thus making this one of the worst hacks ever reported.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: September 8, 2017 - Equifax says it suffered a massive data breach involving as many as 143 million people in the U.S. Social Security numbers, birth dates, addresses and drivers licenses were apparently exposed, thus making this one of the worst hacks ever reported. http://www.npr.org/2017/09/08/549549935/equifax-breach-exposes-personal-data-of-143-million-people

item.description:

item.title: News Brief: Mexico Earthquake, Florida Evacuates, Equifax Data Breach
item.description: September 8, 2017 - Reporter Emily Green talks about a massive earthquake off the coast of Mexico. Also, the latest on Hurricane Irma, and TechCrunch writer John Mannes talks about a massive data breach at Equifax.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: September 8, 2017 - Reporter Emily Green talks about a massive earthquake off the coast of Mexico. Also, the latest on Hurricane Irma, and TechCrunch writer John Mannes talks about a massive data breach at Equifax. http://www.npr.org/2017/09/08/549373719/news-brief-mexico-earthquake-florida-evacuates-equifax-data-breach

item.title: Credit Reporting Agency Equifax Reveals Massive Hack
item.description: September 8, 2017 - NPR's David Greene talks to Washington Post reporter Craig Timberg about the hacking of credit reporting agency Equifax. Hackers may have gained access to data from 143 million Americans.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: September 8, 2017 - NPR's David Greene talks to Washington Post reporter Craig Timberg about the hacking of credit reporting agency Equifax. Hackers may have gained access to data from 143 million Americans. http://www.npr.org/2017/09/08/549373796/credit-reporting-agency-equifax-reveals-massive-hack

item.title: Hackers Accessed The Personal Data Of 143 Million People, Equifax Says
item.description: September 7, 2017 - The international credit reporting agency says a cybersecurity breach exposed Americans' personal information — including Social Security numbers and addresses — for a span of about two months.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: September 7, 2017 - The international credit reporting agency says a cybersecurity breach exposed Americans' personal information — including Social Security numbers and addresses — for a span of about two months. http://www.npr.org/sections/thetwo-way/2017/09/07/549296359/hackers-accessed-the-personal-data-of-143-million-people-equifax-says

item.title: Amazon Set To Build A Second HQ And Cities Say 'Pick Me!'
item.description: September 7, 2017 - The announcement set off a hot municipal contest — and one big thought experiment. Mayors across North America said their cities would be the perfect home for 50,000 jobs and a $5 billion investment.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: September 7, 2017 - The announcement set off a hot municipal contest — and one big thought experiment. Mayors across North America said their cities would be the perfect home for 50,000 jobs and a $5 billion investment. http://www.npr.org/sections/thetwo-way/2017/09/07/549255564/amazon-set-to-build-a-second-hq-and-cities-say-pick-me

item.title: Amazon Plans To Open Second Headquarters With 50,000 Jobs
item.description: September 7, 2017 - Amazon is setting out to find a location for a second headquarters, which should touch off intense competition among cities. The new HQ will bring along 50,000 high-paying jobs.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: September 7, 2017 - Amazon is setting out to find a location for a second headquarters, which should touch off intense competition among cities. The new HQ will bring along 50,000 high-paying jobs. http://www.npr.org/2017/09/07/549250141/amazon-plans-to-open-second-headquarters-with-50-000-jobs
